paras.en: the first time i meet Olivia's little brother, i have to admit i'm totally taken by surprise. i shouldn't be, of course. olivia's told me about his "syndrome." has even described what he looks like. but she's also talked about all his surgeries over the years, so i guess i assumed he'd be more normal-looking by now. like when a kid is born with a cleft palate and has plastic surgery to fix it sometimes you can't even tell except for the little scar above the lip. i guess i thought her brother would have some scars here and there. but not this. i definitely wasn't expecting to see this little kid in a baseball cap who's sitting in front of me right now.
paras.cn: 我第一次见到奥利维亚的弟弟时，我得承认我完全被吓到了。当然，我不该这样的。奥利维亚跟我说过他的“综合征”。甚至描述过他长什么样。但她也谈到过他这些年来的所有手术，所以我猜我以为他现在会长得更正常一些。就像一个孩子天生有腭裂，做了整形手术修复后，有时候你甚至都看不出来，除了嘴唇上方那道小疤痕。我猜我以为她弟弟会这儿那儿有些疤痕。但不是这样。我绝对没料到会看到现在坐在我面前的这个戴着棒球帽的小孩。

vocab.ex: He was completely taken by surprise when they all shouted 'Happy Birthday!'
The doctor diagnosed him with a rare genetic syndrome.
I assumed you already knew about the meeting.
The charity raises money for children who need surgery for their cleft palate.
There were a few flowers blooming here and there in the garden.

gram.name: 意识流风格
gram.pattern: Lack of capitalization, fragmented sentences, and informal tone.
gram.function: 作者通过故意不使用大写字母、使用句子片段和口语化的语言，模仿了一种未经修饰的、原始的内心独白。这种“意识流”的风格让读者感觉自己正在直接阅读角色的思想，增强了叙述的即时性和真实感，深刻地传达了角色在初次见面时的震惊和混乱思绪。

example.en: walked down the street. sun was bright. felt good. then i saw her.
example.cn: 走在街上。阳光明媚。感觉很好。然后我看到了她。

gram.constraints: 是一种故意打破常规语法规则以达到特定文学效果的写作技巧。

paras.en: actually there are two kids sitting in front me: one is a totally normal-looking kid with curly blond hair named jack; the other is auggie. i like to think i'm able to hide my surprise. i hope i do. surprise is one of those emotions that can be hard to fake, though, whether you're trying to look surprised when you're not or trying to not look surprised when you are.
paras.cn: 其实我面前坐着两个孩子：一个是长相完全正常的、名叫杰克的卷发金发小孩；另一个是奥吉。我愿意相信我能够隐藏我的惊讶。我希望我做到了。不过，惊讶是那种很难伪装的情绪之一，无论你是想在不惊讶时装出惊讶，还是在惊讶时努力不显得惊讶。

vocab.ex: He was just a normal-looking guy you wouldn't notice in a crowd.

vocab.mean: 愿意相信（但可能并非事实）
vocab.ex: I like to think I'm a patient person, but sometimes I lose my temper.
You can't fake sincerity; people will know.

gram.name: 交错配列与平行结构
gram.pattern: ...[A] when you're not or... not [A] when you are.
gram.function: 通过一个复杂的、近乎交错配列的平行结构（'...trying to look surprised when you're not or trying to not look surprised when you are'），作者深刻地阐述了伪装“惊讶”这种情绪的双向困难。这种对称而复杂的句式，反映了叙述者内心的挣扎和对社交细微之处的敏锐洞察。

example.en: It's hard to act happy when you're sad, and just as hard to not act happy when you are.
example.cn: 悲伤时假装快乐很难，快乐时不去表现也同样困难。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过句法对称来表达复杂思想的高级修辞手法。

paras.en: i shake his hand. i shake the other kid's hand. don't want to focus on his face. cool room, I say. are you via's boyfriend? he says. i think he's smiling. olivia pushes down his baseball cap. is that a machine gun? the blond kid asks, like i haven't heard that one before. and we talk about zydeco for a bit. and then via's taking my hand and leading me out of the room. as soon as we close the door behind us, we hear them laughing. i'm from brooklyn! one of them sings. olivia rolls her eyes as she smiles. let's go hang out in my room, she says.
paras.cn: 我握了他的手。我握了另一个孩子的手。不想把注意力集中在他的脸上。很酷的房间，我说。你是维娅的男朋友吗？他说。我想他在笑。奥利维亚把他的棒球帽往下按。那是机关枪吗？那个金发小孩问，说得好像我以前没听过这个似的。然后我们聊了一会儿柴迪科。接着维娅就拉着我的手，带我出了房间。我们一关上身后的门，就听到他们在笑。我来自布鲁克林！其中一个唱道。奥利维亚笑着翻了个白眼。我们去我房间玩吧，她说。

vocab.ex: Please focus on your work and stop getting distracted.
Can we talk for a bit after the meeting?
The guide led the group out of the dark cave.
She rolled her eyes when her brother started telling another one of his boring stories.

gram.name: 断奏式短句
gram.pattern: A series of short, simple present tense sentences.
gram.function: 通过使用一系列极简的、现在时的句子（'i shake his hand.', 'cool room, I say.', 'he says.'），作者创造了一种快速、即时、近乎电影蒙太奇的叙事节奏。这种风格模仿了人在紧张或不知所措时，思维变得碎片化、只关注眼前直接动作的状态，生动地传达了叙述者的不安和感官超载。

example.en: The bell rings. I grab my bag. I run for the door.
example.cn: 铃响了。我抓住我的包。我朝门口跑去。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过句法来表现人物心理状态的有效技巧。

paras.en: we've been dating for two months now. i knew from the moment i saw her, the minute she sat down at our table in the cafeteria, that i liked her. i couldn't keep my eyes off of her. really beautiful. with olive skin and the bluest eyes i've ever seen in my life. at first she acted like she only wanted to be friends. i think she kind of gives off that vibe without even meaning to. stay back. don't even bother. she doesn't flirt like some other girls do. she looks you right in the eye when she talks to you, like she's daring you. so i just kept looking her right in the eye, too, like i was daring her right back. and then i asked her out and she said yes, which rocked.
paras.cn: 我们现在已经约会两个月了。从我见到她的那一刻起，从她在餐厅我们桌旁坐下的那一分钟起，我就知道我喜欢她。我的目光无法从她身上移开。真的很美。有着橄榄色的皮肤和我在我一生中见过的最蓝的眼睛。起初她表现得好像只想做朋友。我想她有点无意中就散发出那种气场。别靠近。甚至别费心。她不像其他一些女孩那样调情。她和你说话时会直视你的眼睛，好像在挑战你一样。所以我也就一直直视着她的眼睛，就像我在回敬她的挑战一样。然后我约她出去，她答应了，那真是太棒了。

vocab.ex: The painting was so beautiful, I couldn't keep my eyes off of it.
People from Mediterranean countries often have beautiful olive skin.
The old library gives off a very calm and studious vibe.
The instructions are too complicated; don't even bother trying to understand them.
He was flirting with the waitress, hoping to get her phone number.
She dared him to a race to the end of the street.
That concert totally rocked!

gram.name: 互动方式的平行比较
gram.pattern: [She did X], like [interpretation]. so I [did X back], like [counter-interpretation].
gram.function: 通过一个对称的、包含比喻的平行结构，叙述者将他与奥利维亚之间的初次互动描绘成一场无声的“挑战”。她直视他，“像是在挑战”；于是他也直视她，“像是在回敬挑战”。这种结构生动地展现了两人之间势均力敌、充满张力的吸引力。

example.en: She threw the ball hard, like she was testing me. So I threw it back even harder, like I was accepting the challenge.
example.cn: 她用力扔球，像是在考验我。于是我更用力地扔了回去，像是在接受挑战。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过对等行为来描述复杂人际动态的有效手法。

paras.en: she's an awesome girl and i love hanging out with her. she didn't tell me about august until our third date. i think she used the phrase "a craniofacial abnormality" to describe his face. or maybe it was "craniofacial anomaly." i know the one word she didn't use was "deformed," though, because that word would have registered with me.
paras.cn: 她是个很棒的女孩，我爱和她一起玩。直到我们第三次约会，她才告诉我关于奥古斯特的事。我想她用了“颅面畸形”这个短语来形容他的脸。或者也许是“颅面异常”。不过我知道她没用的一个词是“畸形的”，因为那个词会给我留下深刻印象。

vocab.ex: We had an awesome time at the concert.
They went on their first date to a coffee shop.
The hospital has a special unit for treating craniofacial abnormalities.
The scientist was studying a strange anomaly in the data.
The accident left his hand permanently deformed.
His name didn't register with me at first, but then I remembered where I had heard it.

gram.name: 对用词选择的关注
gram.pattern: Analyzing the specific words someone used or didn't use.
gram.function: 叙述者通过仔细回忆奥利维亚使用的确切词语（'craniofacial abnormality' 或 'anomaly'）并明确指出她没有使用的词（'deformed'），揭示了他对语言细微差别的敏感。这不仅显示了他对奥利维亚的关心（注意到她选择用更客观、科学的词汇），也暗示了“deformed”这个词所带有的强烈负面情感冲击力。

example.en: He didn't say he 'disliked' the plan; he said he 'despised' it. The difference is important.
example.cn: 他没说他‘不喜欢’这个计划；他说他‘鄙视’它。这其中的差别很重要。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过分析语言来揭示人物性格和情感的技巧。

paras.en: so, what did you think? she asks me nervously the second we're inside her room. are you shocked? no, i lie. she smiles and looks away. you're shocked. i'm not, i assure her. he's just like what you said he'd be. she nods and plops down on her bed. kind of cute how she still has a lot of stuffed animals on her bed. she takes one of them, a polar bear, without thinking and puts it in her lap.
paras.cn: 所以，你觉得怎么样？我们一进她房间她就紧张地问我。你震惊吗？不，我撒谎道。她笑了笑，移开目光。你震惊了。我没有，我向她保证。他就和你说的样子一样。她点点头，扑通一声坐到她的床上。她床上还放着很多毛绒玩具，有点可爱。她不假思索地拿起其中一个，一只北极熊，放在她的腿上。

vocab.ex: He glanced nervously at his watch, worried he was going to be late.
I can assure you that everything will be fine.
After a long day, he plopped down on the sofa.
The child's bed was covered in stuffed animals.
He reacted without thinking and grabbed the falling glass.

gram.name: 非语言线索（作为安慰物）
gram.pattern: A character unconsciously interacts with an object for comfort.
gram.function: 通过描述奥利维亚“不假思索地”拿起一只北极熊放在腿上的行为，作者揭示了她内心的紧张和需要安慰的状态。毛绒玩具在此处成了一个“安慰物”，她的这个无意识的动作比任何语言都更能真实地反映出她对贾斯汀反应的担忧。

example.en: While waiting for the results, she kept twisting the ring on her finger.
example.cn: 在等待结果时，她不停地转动着手指上的戒指。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过人物与物体的互动来揭示其潜意识状态的有效技巧。

paras.en: i sit down on the rolling chair by her desk. her room is immaculate. when i was little, she says, there were lots of kids who never came back for a second playdate. i mean, lots of kids. i even had friends who wouldn't come to my birthdays because he would be there. they never actually told me this, but it would get back to me. some people just don't know how to deal with auggie, you know?
paras.cn: 我坐在她书桌旁的滚轮椅上。她的房间一尘不染。我小的时候，她说，有很多孩子再也没来过第二次游戏约会。我是说，很多孩子。我甚至有过一些朋友，因为他会在那里，就不来参加我的生日派对。他们从没真的告诉我这个，但话总会传到我这里。有些人就是不知道怎么应对奥吉，你知道吗？

vocab.ex: She always keeps her house in immaculate condition.
My son has a playdate with his friend this afternoon.
I don't know how, but the news of my promotion got back to my old boss.
It's a difficult situation, and I'm not sure how to deal with it.

gram.name: 重复以示情感强调
gram.pattern: Statement, followed by a repetitive emphasis.
gram.function: 通过在一个陈述（'there were lots of kids...'）之后，紧跟一个带有强调语气的重复（'i mean, lots of kids.'），叙述者加强了这句话的情感分量。这种重复模仿了口语中为了确保听者理解问题严重性而进行的强调。

example.en: It was cold. I mean, really cold.
example.cn: 天很冷。我的意思是，真的非常冷。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的口语化强调方式。

paras.en: i nod. it's not even like they know they're being mean, she adds. they were just scared. i mean, let's face it, his face is a little scary, right? i guess, i answer. but you're okay with it? she asks me sweetly. you're not too freaked out? or scared? i'm not freaked out or scared. i smile. she nods and looks down at the polar bear on her lap. i can't tell whether she believes me or not, but then she gives the polar bear a kiss on the nose and tosses it to me with a little smile. i think that means she believes me. or at least that she wants to.
paras.cn: 我点头。他们甚至不像知道自己很刻薄，她补充道。他们只是害怕。我的意思是，面对现实吧，他的脸是有点吓人，对吧？我猜是吧，我回答。但你对此没问题吗？她甜甜地问我。你没有被吓坏吧？或者害怕？我没有被吓坏，也没有害怕。我笑了。她点点头，低头看着她腿上的北极熊。我看不出她到底信不信我，但接着她亲了一下北极熊的鼻子，带着浅笑把它扔给了我。我想那意味着她相信我。或者至少她愿意相信。

vocab.ex: The teacher nodded to show she understood the student's question.
Let's face it, we are not going to win this game.
She was completely freaked out by the spider on her pillow.
He had a neutral expression, so I couldn't tell whether he was happy or sad.
He tossed the empty bottle into the recycling bin.
I don't know if he'll come, but at least I invited him.

gram.name: 非语言交流作为解决方案
gram.pattern: An action with a symbolic object is used to communicate trust or acceptance.
gram.function: 在这段充满不确定性的对话（'i can't tell whether she believes me or not'）的结尾，奥利维亚没有用语言，而是通过一个象征性的动作——亲吻代表着脆弱和需要安慰的北极熊，然后把它“扔”给贾斯汀——来传达她的信任。这个动作成了一种非语言的交流，表示她愿意将自己的脆弱（由北极熊代表）托付给他。这是一种比直接说“我相信你”更深刻、更富有层次感的情感表达。

example.en: Instead of saying 'I love you,' he simply handed her the single red rose.
example.cn: 他没有说‘我爱你’，只是递给了她那枝红玫瑰。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过象征性行为来推动人物关系发展的文学技巧。

paras.en: i give olivia a heart necklace for valentine's day, and she gives me a messenger bag she's made out of old floppy disks. very cool how she makes things like that. earrings out of pieces of circuit boards. dresses out of t-shirts. bags out of old jeans. she's so creative. i tell her she should be an artist someday, but she wants to be a scientist. a geneticist, of all things. she wants to find cures for people like her brother, i guess.
paras.cn: 情人节我送给奥利维亚一条心形项链，她送给我一个她用旧软盘做的邮差包。她能做出那样的东西真是太酷了。用电路板碎片做的耳环。用T恤做的裙子。用旧牛仔裤做的包。她太有创造力了。我告诉她她将来应该成为一名艺术家，但她想成为一名科学家。偏偏还是遗传学家。我猜，她想为像她弟弟那样的人找到治愈方法。

vocab.ex: He carried his laptop and books in a sturdy messenger bag.
Before USB drives, people used floppy disks to save their files.
The technician had to replace a faulty circuit board in the computer.
She is a very creative artist who is always experimenting with new styles.
The geneticist was studying the causes of inherited diseases.
He decided to become a clown, of all things!
Scientists are working hard to find a cure for the disease.

gram.name: 连接词省略法（用于列举创作）
gram.pattern: A series of phrases without conjunctions.
gram.function: 通过列举一系列没有连词连接的名词短语（'earrings out of...', 'dresses out of...', 'bags out of...'），作者创造了一种快速、富有节奏感的清单式描述。这种连接词省略法（Asyndeton）有效地突显了奥利维亚创造力的多样性和丰富性。

example.en: He was a man of many talents: a painter, a writer, a musician.
example.cn: 他是个多才多艺的人：一个画家、一个作家、一个音乐家。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过句法简洁来增强效果的修辞技巧。

paras.en: we make plans for me to finally meet her parents. a mexican restaurant on amesfort avenue near her house on saturday night. all day long i'm nervous about it. and when i get nervous my tics come out. i mean, my tics are always there, but they're not like they used to be when i was little: nothing but a few hard blinks now, the occasional head pull. but when i'm stressed they get worse— and i'm definitely stressing about meeting her folks.
paras.cn: 我们计划让我终于见见她的父母。周六晚上在她家附近的艾姆斯福特大道上的一家墨西哥餐厅。我一整天都为此感到紧张。而当我紧张时，我的抽动症就会发作。我的意思是，我的抽动症一直都在，但已经不像我小时候那样了：现在不过是几次用力的眨眼，偶尔的头部抽动。但当我压力大时，它们会变得更糟——而我绝对在为见她家人而感到压力。

vocab.ex: He always gets nervous before a big presentation.
He has a nervous tic where he constantly blinks his eyes.
A quick blink is a natural reflex to protect the eye.
He enjoys an occasional glass of wine with dinner.
Don't stress about the exam; you've studied hard.
He's going home to visit his folks for the holidays.

gram.name: nothing but (表示限定)
gram.pattern: nothing but + Noun Phrase
gram.function: 用于强调某事物是唯一的组成部分，意为“只不过是…；仅仅是…”。'...nothing but a few hard blinks now...' 强调了现在抽动症的表现形式非常有限，与过去形成了对比。

example.en: After the fire, there was nothing but ashes left of the house.
example.cn: 火灾过后，房子只剩下了一片灰烬。

gram.constraints: 是一种强调限定范围的表达方式。

paras.en: they're waiting inside when i get to the restaurant. the dad gets up and shakes my hand, and the mom gives me a hug. i give auggie a hello fist-punch and kiss olivia on the cheek before i sit down. it's so nice to meet you, justin! we've heard so much about you! her parents couldn't be nicer. put me at ease right away. the waiter brings over the menus and i notice his expression the moment he lays eyes on august. but i pretend not to notice. i guess we're all pretending not to notice things tonight. the waiter. my tics. the way august crushes the tortilla chips on the table and spoons the crumbs into his mouth. i look at olivia and she smiles at me. she knows. she sees the waiter's face. she sees my tics. olivia is a girl who sees everything.
paras.cn: 我到餐厅时他们正在里面等。爸爸站起来和我握手，妈妈给了我一个拥抱。我给了奥吉一个问好的碰拳，在坐下前亲了奥利维亚的脸颊。很高兴认识你，贾斯汀！我们听过很多关于你的事！她的父母再友好不过了。立刻就让我放松了下来。服务员拿来菜单，我注意到他一看到奥古斯特时的表情。但我假装没注意到。我猜今晚我们都在假装没注意到一些事情。服务员。我的抽动症。奥古斯特把玉米片在桌上压碎，然后用勺子把碎屑送进嘴里的方式。我看着奥利维亚，她对我笑了。她知道。她看到了服务员的脸。她看到了我的抽动症。奥利维亚是个能看到一切的女孩。

vocab.ex: Instead of a handshake, they greeted each other with a friendly fist-punch.
Thank you for the gift; you couldn't be nicer.
His calm voice and friendly smile immediately put me at ease.
I haven't laid eyes on him in years.
He loves to eat tortilla chips with salsa.

gram.name: 使用片段的平行结构（未被注意之事）
gram.pattern: List of noun phrases acting as objects of an unstated verb.
gram.function: 在陈述了“我们都在假装没注意到一些事情”之后，作者用了一系列并列的名词片段（'the waiter.', 'my tics.', 'the way...'）来具体列举这些被“假装没注意到”的事情。这种结构创造了一种清单式的、富有节奏感的效果，强调了在这个看似正常的家庭聚餐背后，存在着多层被刻意忽略的紧张和不适。

example.en: The room was full of things he didn't want to think about. The unpaid bills. The angry emails. The impending deadline.
example.cn: 房间里充满了他不想去想的事情。未付的账单。愤怒的邮件。迫在眉睫的截止日期。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过列举片段来增强情感和画面感的文学技巧。

paras.en: we spend the entire dinner talking and laughing. olivia's parents ask me about my music, how i got into the fiddle and stuff like that. and i tell them about how i used to play classical violin but I got into appalachian folk music and then zydeco. and they're listening to every word like they're really interested. they tell me to let them know the next time my band's playing a gig so they can come listen. i'm not used to all the attention, to be truthful. my parents don't have a clue about what I want to do with my life. they never ask. we never talk like this.
paras.cn: 我们整个晚餐都在聊天和欢笑。奥利维亚的父母问我关于我音乐的事，我是如何迷上小提琴之类的。我告诉他们我过去常拉古典小提琴，但后来迷上了阿巴拉契亚民间音乐，然后是柴迪科。他们听着我的每一个字，好像他们真的感兴趣一样。他们让我下次我的乐队有演出时告诉他们，这样他们可以来听。说实话，我不习惯所有的关注。我父母对我的人生想做什么毫无头绪。他们从不问。我们从不像这样交谈。

vocab.ex: How did you first get into playing the guitar?

vocab.mean: （尤指用于民间音乐的）小提琴
vocab.ex: The musician played a lively tune on his fiddle.
Banjos and fiddles are common instruments in Appalachian folk music.
My band has a gig at the local pub this Friday.
I don't have a clue how to solve this math problem.

gram.name: 通过否定性短句进行对比
gram.pattern: A positive experience followed by a series of short, negative statements about one's own reality.
gram.function: 在详细描述了与奥利维亚家人温暖、投入的交流之后，叙述者用了一系列非常简短、有力的否定句（'my parents don't have a clue...', 'they never ask.', 'we never talk like this.'）来与自己的家庭进行对比。这种结构创造了强烈的反差，深刻地突显了他对自己家庭情感缺失的感受，以及奥利维亚家庭的温暖对他的巨大冲击。

example.en: Her house was full of laughter and joy. My house was silent. No one ever talked. No one ever smiled.
example.cn: 她的家充满了欢声笑语。我的家却很安静。从没人说话。从没人笑过。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过对比和简洁句式来产生强烈情感效果的技巧。

paras.en: i don't think they even know i traded my baroque violin for an eight-string hardanger fiddle two years ago. after dinner we go back to olivia's for some ice cream. their dog greets us at the door. an old dog. super sweet. she'd thrown up all over the hallway, though. olivia's mom rushes to get paper towels while the dad picks the dog up like she's a baby. what's up, ol' girlie? he says, and the dog's in heaven, tongue hanging out, tail wagging, legs in the air at awkward angles. dad, tell justin how you got daisy, says olivia.
paras.cn: 我想他们甚至不知道我两年前用我的巴洛克小提琴换了一把八弦的哈丹格尔小提琴。晚饭后我们回到奥利维亚家吃冰淇淋。他们的狗在门口迎接我们。一只老狗。超级甜。不过，她吐得整个走廊都是。奥利维亚的妈妈冲去拿纸巾，而爸爸则像抱婴儿一样把狗抱起来。怎么了，老姑娘？他说，那狗简直上了天堂，舌头伸出来，尾巴摇着，腿以尴尬的角度翘在空中。爸，告诉贾斯汀你是怎么得到黛西的，奥利维亚说。

vocab.ex: He decided to trade his old car for a new motorcycle.

vocab.mean: 哈丹格尔小提琴（一种挪威民间乐器）
vocab.ex: The Hardanger fiddle is known for its sympathetic strings that resonate.
He ate some bad seafood and felt like he was going to throw up.
The paramedics rushed to the scene of the accident.
Lying on the beach with a good book, she felt like she was in heaven.
He felt awkward at the party because he didn't know anyone.

gram.name: 混乱与爱的并置
gram.pattern: A negative event is immediately followed by a scene of unconditional love and care.
gram.function: 通过将一个不愉快的、混乱的事件（狗吐了）与父母随后充满爱意、毫无怨言的反应（妈妈冲去拿纸巾，爸爸像抱婴儿一样抱起狗）并置，作者深刻地展现了这个家庭的本质：他们不畏惧混乱和不完美，而是用爱和关怀来应对。这个场景成为这个家庭温暖氛围的一个强有力的象征。

example.en: The baby spilled milk all over the floor, but the mother just laughed and started cleaning it up.
example.cn: 宝宝把牛奶洒了一地，但妈妈只是笑了笑，就开始清理起来。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过具体事件来揭示人物和家庭深层特质的文学技巧。

paras.en: yeah! says auggie. the dad smiles and sits down in a chair with the dog still cradled in his arms. it's obvious he's told this story lots of times and they all love to hear it. so i'm coming home from the subway one day, he says, and a homeless guy i've never seen in this neighborhood before is pushing this floppy mutt in a stroller, and he comes up to me and says, hey, mister, wanna buy my dog? and without even thinking about it, i say sure, how much you want? and he says ten bucks, so i give him the twenty dollars i have in my wallet and he hands me the dog. justin, i'm telling you, you've never smelled anything so bad in your life! she stank so much i can't even tell you! so i took her right from there to the vet down the street and then i brought her home.
paras.cn: 是啊！奥吉说。爸爸笑了，抱着那只仍被他 cradled 在怀里的狗坐到椅子上。很明显这个故事他已经讲过很多次了，而且他们都爱听。所以我有一天从地铁回家，他说，一个我以前从没在这个社区见过的流浪汉，正用婴儿车推着这只软趴趴的杂种狗，他走上前来对我说，嘿，先生，想买我的狗吗？我想都没想就说，当然，你想要多少钱？他说十块钱，所以我把我钱包里的二十美元给了他，他把狗递给了我。贾斯汀，我跟你说，你这辈子从没闻过那么臭的东西！她臭得我都无法形容！所以我直接从那里带她去了街那头的兽医那里，然后我把她带回了家。

vocab.ex: She cradled the sleeping baby in her arms.
It was obvious that he was not happy with the decision.
The city is trying to provide more shelters for the homeless population.
The puppy had big, floppy ears.
He adopted a friendly mutt from the animal shelter.
The garbage had been left out for days and it stank.
We need to take the cat to the vet for its annual check-up.

gram.name: 一般现在时（用于讲故事/历史现在时）
gram.pattern: Using simple present tense to narrate a past event.
gram.function: 父亲在讲述过去发生的故事时，使用了一般现在时（'so i'm coming home...', 'he comes up to me and says...'）。这种“历史现在时”的用法，可以使过去的故事听起来更生动、更具即时性，仿佛正在听者眼前发生一样，是一种非常吸引人的讲故事技巧。

example.en: So, I'm walking down the street yesterday, and suddenly this guy comes up to me and asks for the time.
example.cn: 所以，我昨天正走在街上，突然这个家伙走上前来问我时间。

gram.constraints: 主要用于非正式的口头叙事中。

paras.en: didn't even call me first, by the way! the mom interjects as she cleans the floor, to see if i'm okay with his bringing home some homeless guy's dog. the dog actually looks over at the mom when she says this, like she understands everything everyone is saying about her. she's a happy dog, like she knows she lucked out that day finding this family.
paras.cn: 顺便说一下，甚至都没先给我打电话！妈妈一边擦地板一边插话，（好像在试探）我是否介意他带回一个流浪汉的狗。狗在妈妈说这话时竟然真的朝她看过去，好像她能听懂每个人在说她的所有事一样。她是一只快乐的狗，好像她知道自己那天找到这个家是交了好运。

vocab.ex: He tried to explain, but she kept interjecting with her own opinions.
We really lucked out with the weather on our vacation.

gram.name: 动物拟人化
gram.pattern: Attributing human thoughts and emotions to an animal.
gram.function: 通过将人类的理解能力和情感归于小狗黛西（'like she understands everything', 'like she knows she lucked out'），作者不仅增添了故事的温情和趣味性，也通过动物的“视角”，进一步强化了这个家庭充满爱和幸运的氛围。

example.en: My cat looked at me with a judgmental stare, as if he disapproved of my life choices.
example.cn: 我的猫用一种评判的眼神看着我，仿佛他不赞成我的人生选择。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的、用于增添情感色彩的文学手法。

paras.en: i kind of know how she feels. i like olivia's family. they laugh a lot. my family's not like this at all. my mom and dad got divorced when i was four and they pretty much hate each other. i grew up spending half of every week in my dad's apartment in chelsea and the other half in my mom's place in brooklyn heights. i have a half brother who's five years older than me and barely knows i exist. for as long as i can remember, i've felt like my parents could hardly wait for me to be old enough to take care of myself.
paras.cn: 我有点明白她的感受。我喜欢奥利维亚的家。他们经常笑。我的家完全不是这样。我爸妈在我四岁时就离婚了，他们差不多是互相憎恨。我从小每周一半时间在我爸爸位于切尔西的公寓里度过，另一半时间在我妈妈位于布鲁克林高地的住处。我有个比我大五岁的同父异母（或同母异父）的哥哥，他几乎不知道我的存在。从我记事起，我就感觉我父母好像迫不及待地等我长大到能自己照顾自己。

vocab.ex: I imagined the party would be fun, but it's not like this at all.
After their bitter divorce, they seemed to hate each other.

vocab.mean: 同父异母或同母异父的兄弟
vocab.ex: He has a half brother from his father's second marriage.
He's so popular and busy, it feels like he barely knows I exist.

vocab.word: for as long as I can remember
vocab.ph: /fɔːr æz lɔːŋ æz aɪ kæn rɪˈmembər/
vocab.ex: For as long as I can remember, she has always wanted to be a doctor.
The children were so excited about Christmas, they could hardly wait for morning to come.

gram.name: 家庭动态的直接对比
gram.pattern: [Positive observation of another family] + 'My family's not like this at all.'
gram.function: 在详细描绘了奥利维亚家庭的温暖、幽默和充满爱意的互动之后，叙述者用一个非常直接、简洁的对比句 'my family's not like this at all'，创造了一个巨大的情感落差。这个转折深刻地揭示了他自己家庭的冷漠和破碎，并为他被奥利维亚家庭所吸引提供了强有力的情感背景。

example.en: Their house was always full of friends and laughter. My house was always silent.
example.cn: 他们的房子总是充满了朋友和欢笑。我的家却总是很安静。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过对比来揭示人物背景和内心感受的强大技巧。

paras.en: "you can go to the store by yourself." "here's the key to the apartment." it's funny how there's a word like overprotective to describe some parents, but no word that means the opposite. what word do you use to describe parents who don't protect enough? underprotective? neglectful? self-involved? lame? all of the above.
paras.cn: “你可以自己去商店了。” “这是公寓的钥匙。” 很奇怪，有像“过度保护”这样的词来形容一些父母，却没有一个意思相反的词。你用什么词来形容那些保护不够的父母呢？保护不足？疏忽的？自我中心的？差劲的？以上所有。

vocab.ex: She felt her parents were being overprotective by not letting her go to the party.
He's very talkative, but his brother is the complete opposite.
His underprotective parents let him do whatever he wanted.
The report criticized the neglectful treatment of the animals at the zoo.
He's too self-involved to notice anyone else's problems.
That's a lame excuse for not doing your homework.
A: Do you want pizza, pasta, or a salad? B: All of the above!

gram.name: 自问自答的反问句
gram.pattern: Ask a rhetorical question and then provide a series of possible answers.
gram.function: 通过提出一个关于语言缺失的反问句（'what word do you use...?'），然后自问自答地列出一系列充满负面情绪的词语，并最终以 'all of the above' 结束，叙述者以一种极其有力的方式表达了他对自己父母的复杂情感和批判。这不仅仅是在寻找一个词，更是在定义一种他所经历的、缺乏关爱的童年。

example.en: What do you call someone who always puts others first? Selfless? Kind? A saint? All of the above.
example.cn: 你如何称呼一个总是把别人放在第一位的人？无私的？善良的？一个圣人？以上所有。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过语言探索和自我回答来构建深刻论点的修辞手法。

paras.en: olivia's family tell each other "i love you" all the time. i can't remember the last time anyone in my family said that to me. by the time i go home, my tics have all stopped.
paras.cn: 奥利维亚的家人总是互相说“我爱你”。我不记得我家有谁上一次对我说那句话是什么时候了。到我回家的时候，我的抽动症全都停止了。

vocab.ex: He talks about his new car all the time.

vocab.mean: 不记得上一次…是什么时候
vocab.ex: I can't remember the last time I had such a good meal.
He has a nervous tic where he constantly blinks his eyes.

gram.name: 并置以暗示因果
gram.pattern: Contrasting observations followed by a statement of physical/emotional change.
gram.function: 作者没有直接说“奥利维亚家的温暖治愈了我的紧张”，而是通过将三个独立的观察和陈述并置：1）奥利维亚家充满爱，2）我的家缺乏爱，3）我的抽动症停止了。这种并置手法让读者自己去建立它们之间的因果联系，从而得出一个比直接陈述更有力、更深刻的结论：情感上的温暖和归属感对叙述者的身心健康产生了直接的、积极的治疗效果。

example.en: The sun came out. The birds started singing. And suddenly, he felt happy.
example.cn: 太阳出来了。鸟儿开始歌唱。突然之间，他感到快乐了。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过暗示而非明示来传达深刻意义的高级文学技巧。

paras.en: we're doing the play our town for the spring show this year. olivia dares me to try out for the lead role, the stage manager, and somehow i get it. total fluke. never got any lead roles in anything before. i tell olivia she brings me good luck. unfortunately, she doesn't get the female lead, emily gibbs. the pink-haired girl named miranda gets it. olivia gets a bit part and is also the emily understudy. i'm actually more disappointed than olivia is. she almost seems relieved.
paras.cn: 我们今年春季演出要做戏剧《我们的小镇》。奥利维亚怂恿我去试镜主角——舞台监督，不知怎地我拿到了。纯属侥幸。以前从没在任何戏里拿到过主角。我告诉奥利维亚她给我带来了好运。不幸的是，她没拿到女主角艾米丽·吉布斯。那个叫米兰达的粉色头发女孩拿到了。奥利维亚得了个小角色，同时也是艾米丽的替补演员。我实际上比奥利维亚还失望。她看起来几乎是松了口气。

vocab.ex: His friends dared him to jump into the cold lake.
She decided to try out for the school basketball team.
He was thrilled to get the lead role in the play.
Winning the lottery was a complete fluke.
She considers the small charm to be a trinket that brings good luck.
He started his acting career with a small bit part in a commercial.
As the understudy, she had to know all the lines for the main role.

vocab.mean: 松了一口气的；感到宽慰的
vocab.ex: I was so relieved to hear that you were safe.

gram.name: 意识流风格
gram.pattern: Lack of capitalization and use of short, declarative sentences.
gram.function: 作者通过故意不使用大写字母和使用一系列简短的陈述句，模仿了一种未经修饰的、原始的内心独白。这种“意识流”的风格让读者感觉自己正在直接阅读角色的思想，增强了叙述的即时性和真实感。

example.en: walked into the room. saw the mess. felt angry. didn't know what to say.
example.cn: 走进房间。看到一片狼藉。感觉生气。不知道该说什么。

gram.constraints: 是一种故意打破常规语法规则以达到特定文学效果的写作技巧。

paras.en: i don't love people staring at me, she says, which is sort of strange coming from such a pretty girl. a part of me thinks maybe she blew her audition on purpose. the spring show is at the end of april. it's mid-march now, so that's less than six weeks to memorize my part. plus rehearsal time. plus practicing with my band. plus finals. plus spending time with olivia. it's going to be a rough six weeks, that's for sure. mr. davenport, the drama teacher, is already manic about the whole thing. will drive us crazy by the time it's over, no doubt. i heard through the grapevine that he'd been planning on doing the elephant man but changed it to our town at the last minute, and that change took a week off of our rehearsal schedule.
paras.cn: 我不喜欢别人盯着我看，她说，这话从这么漂亮的女孩嘴里说出来有点奇怪。我内心一部分觉得她可能是故意搞砸了试镜。春季演出在四月底。现在是三月中旬，所以剩下不到六周的时间来记我的台词。加上排练时间。加上和我的乐队练习。加上期末考试。加上和奥利维亚待在一起的时间。这将会是艰难的六周，那是肯定的。戏剧老师达文波特先生已经对整件事表现得狂躁了。等结束的时候，他毫无疑问会把我们逼疯。我听小道消息说，他本来打算做《象人》，但在最后一刻改成了《我们的小镇》，这个改变让我们的排练日程少了一周。

vocab.ex: He was so nervous that he completely blew his audition.
I'm sorry, I didn't break it on purpose.
The cast has a final rehearsal tonight before the opening show.
He's been having a rough time since he lost his job.
Before a big performance, she always enters a manic phase of last-minute preparations.
She's the best candidate for the job, no doubt.
I heard through the grapevine that the company is planning layoffs.
He cancelled the trip at the last minute.

gram.name: 使用 'plus' 列举压力
gram.pattern: Main task. plus [task 2]. plus [task 3]...
gram.function: 通过重复使用 'plus' 来连接一系列并列的名词短语，作者创造了一种压力层层叠加的感觉。这种清单式的结构，有效地传达了叙述者在未来六周内将要面临的多重任务和巨大压力。

example.en: I have to finish this report. Plus my regular work. Plus I have to prepare for a meeting.
example.cn: 我得完成这份报告。加上我的常规工作。再加上我得准备一个会议。

gram.constraints: 是一种在口语中常见的、用于累加要点的表达方式。

paras.en: not looking forward to the craziness of the next month and a half.
paras.cn: 不期待接下来一个半月的疯狂。

vocab.ex: I'm not looking forward to the dentist appointment tomorrow.
The holiday shopping season is pure craziness at the mall.
We have a month and a half to finish this project.

gram.name: 结论性句子片段
gram.pattern: A grammatically incomplete sentence used for effect.
gram.function: 在一段内心独白之后，使用一个语法上不完整的句子片段作为结尾，可以创造一种强烈的、总结性的效果。'not looking forward to...' 省略了主语 'i'm'，使其听起来更像一个直接、发自内心的想法，有力地概括了叙述者对未来的忧虑情绪。

example.en: So much work to do. So little time.
example.cn: 这么多工作要做。这么少的时间。

gram.constraints: 是一种文学和修辞手法，用于增强语气和节奏。

paras.en: olivia and i are sitting on her front stoop. she's helping me with my lines. it's a warm march evening, almost like summer. the sky is still bright cyan but the sun is low and the sidewalks are streaked with long shadows. i'm reciting: yes, the sun's come up over a thousand times. summers and winters have cracked the mountains a little bit more and the rains have brought down some of the dirt. some babies that weren't even born before have begun talking regular sentences already; and a number of people who thought they were right young and spry have noticed that they can't bound up a flight of stairs like they used to, without their heart fluttering a little. . . .
paras.cn: 奥利维亚和我在她家门前的台阶上坐着。她在帮我对台词。这是一个温暖的三月傍晚，几乎像夏天一样。天空依旧是明亮的青色，但太阳已经低垂，人行道上划过长长的影子。我正在背诵：是的，太阳已经升起过一千多次了。夏天和冬天让山脉又多裂开了一点点，雨水也冲下了一些泥土。一些以前还没出生的婴儿已经开始说完整的句子了；还有一些自以为年轻矫健的人已经注意到，他们不能像以前那样一跃跳上一段楼梯，而心脏不稍微扑腾一下了……

vocab.ex: They sat on the stoop, watching the people walk by.
The actor had to memorize hundreds of lines for the play.
The printer was out of cyan ink.
Her hair was streaked with gray at the temples.
She had to recite a poem in front of the class.

vocab.mean: （尤指老人）精神矍铄的；矫健的
vocab.ex: My 80-year-old grandfather is still quite spry.
The excited dog bound up the stairs to greet its owner.
His heart began to flutter with excitement.

gram.name: 互文性（用于主题共鸣）
gram.pattern: Quoting an external text that reflects the scene's theme.
gram.function: 通过引用戏剧《我们的小镇》中关于时间流逝、生命变迁的台词，作者为这个看似平静的场景注入了深刻的哲学意涵。戏剧的台词与角色们自身正经历的青春时光、情感变化形成了共鸣，暗示了这个傍晚的美好和转瞬即逝。

example.en: As he looked at the old photograph, he thought of the line from the poem: 'Nothing gold can stay.'
example.cn: 当他看着那张老照片时，他想起了那句诗：‘沒有一樣美好的東西可以永久停留。’

gram.constraints: 是一种通过引用其他文本来深化当前叙事主题的高级文学技巧。

paras.en: i shake my head. can't remember the rest. all that can happen in a thousand days, olivia prompts me, reading from the script. right, right, right, i say, shaking my head. i sigh. i'm wiped, olivia. how the heck am i going to remember all these lines? you will, she answers confidently. she reaches out and cups her hands over a ladybug that appears out of nowhere. see? a good luck sign, she says, slowly lifting her top hand to reveal the ladybug walking on the palm of her other hand.
paras.cn: 我摇了摇头。记不住剩下的了。一千天里可能发生所有这些事，奥利维亚提示我，读着剧本。对，对，对，我摇着头说。我叹了口气。我累垮了，奥利维亚。我到底怎么才能记住所有这些台词？你会的，她自信地回答。她伸出手，把手拢在一只不知从哪儿冒出来的瓢虫上。看到了吗？一个好运的标志，她说，慢慢抬起上面的手，露出那只正在她另一只手掌上行走的瓢虫。

vocab.ex: If you forget your lines, I'll be in the wings ready to prompt you.
The actors were given their scripts a week before rehearsal.
After studying all night for the exam, I feel completely wiped.
How the heck did you manage to fix that?
She walked onto the stage and spoke confidently to the audience.
He cupped his hands over the small bird to protect it from the wind.
It's considered good luck if a ladybug lands on you.
A car came out of nowhere and almost hit us.
He lifted the cloth to reveal a beautiful painting.
He held the small bird gently in the palm of his hand.

gram.name: 用象征主义进行重塑框架
gram.pattern: Responding to a problem by introducing a positive symbol.
gram.function: 面对贾斯汀的焦虑和抱怨，奥利维亚没有直接进行说教，而是抓住了一个偶然的事件（瓢虫的出现），并将其“重塑”为一个积极的象征（'a good luck sign'）。这是一种非常巧妙的沟通技巧，通过转移焦点和赋予事物积极意义，来改变对话的情感基调，从消极转向积极和充满希望。

example.en: When he was sad about failing, she pointed to a rainbow and said, 'Look, a sign that better things are coming.'
example.cn: 当他为失败而悲伤时，她指着一道彩虹说：‘看，一个预示着好事即将来临的迹象。’

gram.constraints: 是一种通过象征来提供情感支持和鼓励的高级沟通技巧。

paras.en: good luck or just the hot weather, i joke. of course good luck, she answers, watching the ladybug crawl up her wrist. there should be a thing about making a wish on a ladybug. auggie and I used to do that with fireflies when we were little. she cups her hand over the ladybug again. come on, make a wish. close your eyes. i dutifully close my eyes. a long second passes, then I open them. did you make a wish? she asks. yep. she smiles, uncups her hands, and the ladybug, as if on cue, spreads its wings and flits away.
paras.cn: 是好运，或者只是天气热，我开玩笑说。当然是好运，她回答，看着瓢虫爬上她的手腕。应该有对着瓢虫许愿这回事。我小时候和奥吉常对着萤火虫那么做。她再次把手拢在瓢虫上。来吧，许个愿。闭上你的眼睛。我尽职地闭上了眼睛。漫长的一秒过去了，然后我睁开它们。你许愿了吗？她问。嗯。她笑了，松开拢着的手，那只瓢虫，仿佛接到了指令，展开翅膀飞走了。

vocab.ex: The spider began to crawl up the wall.
She wore a beautiful bracelet on her wrist.
In the summer evening, we watched the fireflies glowing in the dark.
He dutifully completed all the tasks his boss assigned him.

vocab.mean: 仿佛接到了指令；恰在此时
vocab.ex: I was just wondering where she was, and as if on cue, she walked through the door.
The eagle spread its wings and soared into the sky.
The butterfly flitted away from flower to flower.

gram.name: 象征性动作
gram.pattern: A physical event that mirrors or symbolizes an emotional or narrative beat.
gram.function: 瓢虫在许愿后立刻“仿佛接到指令般”飞走，这个动作在叙事中起到了强烈的象征作用。它不仅仅是一个巧合，更像是一个魔法般的瞬间，象征着愿望已经被“送出”或被宇宙“接收”。这个小小的动作，为整个浪漫、充满希望的场景画上了一个完美的句号。

example.en: As he finally made his decision, the sun broke through the clouds.
example.cn: 当他终于做出决定时，太阳冲破了云层。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过自然或物理事件来增强情感和主题的文学技巧。

paras.en: don't you want to know what I wished for? i ask, kissing her. no, she answers shyly, looking up at the sky, which, at this very moment, is the exact color of her eyes. i made a wish, too, she says mysteriously, but she has so many things she could wish for I have no idea what she's thinking.
paras.cn: 你不想知道我许了什么愿吗？我问，亲吻着她。不，她害羞地回答，抬头看着天空，而天空，就在此刻，和她眼睛的颜色一模一样。我也许了个愿，她神秘地说，但她可以许的愿太多了，我完全不知道她在想什么。

vocab.ex: What did you wish for on your birthday?
The little girl smiled shyly and hid behind her mother.
At this very moment, a new star is being born somewhere in the universe.
He was looking for a paint that was the exact color of the ocean.
She smiled mysteriously but wouldn't tell me her secret.
I have no idea where I left my keys.

gram.name: 浪漫主义明喻
gram.pattern: Comparing a person's feature to a vast, beautiful natural element.
gram.function: 通过将奥利维亚的眼睛比作天空的颜色，作者使用了一个经典的浪漫主义手法，将人物的美与自然的宏伟和美丽联系起来。这个比喻不仅强调了她的美丽，也为这个亲密的瞬间增添了一层诗意和永恒感。

example.en: Her voice was like the gentle sound of a flowing river.
example.cn: 她的声音就像潺潺的河水般温柔。

gram.constraints: 是一种在文学中常见的、用于提升情感和意境的技巧。

paras.en: olivia's mom, auggie, jack, and daisy come down the stoop just as i'm saying goodbye to olivia. slightly awkward since we are in the middle of a nice long kiss. hey, guys, says the mom, pretending not to see anything, but the two boys are giggling. hi, mrs. pullman. please call me isabel, justin, she says again. it's like the third time she's told me this, so i really need to start calling her that. i'm heading home, i say, as if to explain. oh, are you heading to the subway? she says, following the dog with a newspaper. can you walk jack to the bus stop? no problem. that okay with you, jack? the mom asks him, and he shrugs. justin, can you stay with him till the bus comes? of course!
paras.cn: 奥利维亚的妈妈、奥吉、杰克和黛西刚从门廊台阶上下来，我正在和奥利维亚告别。有点尴尬，因为我们正在一个美好的长吻之中。嘿，各位，妈妈说，假装什么也没看见，但那两个男孩在咯咯笑。嗨，普尔曼夫人。请叫我伊莎贝尔，贾斯汀，她又说了一遍。这好像是她第三次这么跟我说了，所以我真的需要开始那么叫她了。我要回家了，我说，好像在解释。哦，你是要去地铁站吗？她说，拿着报纸跟在狗后面。你能送杰克去公交车站吗？没问题。你觉得可以吗，杰克？妈妈问他，他耸了耸肩。贾斯汀，你能陪他到公交车来吗？当然！

vocab.ex: They sat on the stoop, watching the people walk by.
The phone rang just as I was leaving the house.
There was an awkward silence after he told the inappropriate joke.
The two girls started to giggle during the quiet movie.
After work, I'm going to head to the gym.
He offered to walk her to her car after the late meeting.

gram.name: 意识流风格
gram.pattern: Lack of capitalization, fragmented sentences, and informal tone.
gram.function: 作者通过故意不使用大写字母、使用句子片段和口语化的语言，模仿了一种未经修饰的、原始的内心独白。这种“意识流”的风格让读者感觉自己正在直接阅读角色的思想，增强了叙述的即时性和真实感。

example.en: walked into the room. saw the mess. felt angry. didn't know what to say.
example.cn: 走进房间。看到一片狼藉。感觉生气。不知道该说什么。

gram.constraints: 是一种故意打破常规语法规则以达到特定文学效果的写作技巧。

paras.en: we all say our goodbyes. olivia winks at me. you don't have to stay with me, says jack as we're walking up the block. i take the bus by myself all the time. auggie's mom is way too overprotective. he's got a low gravelly voice, like a little tough guy. he kind of looks like one of those little-rascal kids in old black-and-white movies, like he should be wearing a newsboy cap and knickers. we get to the bus stop and the schedule says the bus will be there in eight minutes. i'll wait with you, i tell him. up to you. he shrugs. can i borrow a dollar? i want some gum.
paras.cn: 我们都道了别。奥利维亚对我眨了眨眼。你不用陪我，杰克在我们沿街区走时说。我一直都是自己坐公交车。奥吉的妈妈太过度保护了。他有种低沉沙哑的声音，像个小硬汉。他有点像那些老黑白电影里的小淘气鬼，好像他应该戴着报童帽和灯笼裤。我们到了公交车站，时刻表上说公交车八分钟后到。我陪你等，我告诉他。随你。他耸耸肩。能借我一块钱吗？我想要点口香糖。

vocab.ex: He winked at me across the room to show it was a secret.
This soup is way too salty to eat.
She felt her parents were being overprotective by not letting her go to the party.
He had a deep, gravelly voice from years of smoking.
In the movie, he always plays the role of a tough guy.
He wore a vintage tweed newsboy cap.
In the old photograph, the boys were wearing knickers and suspenders.
We can go to the movies or stay home. It's up to you.
Do you have a piece of gum?

gram.name: 原型比喻
gram.pattern: Noun + looks like + [archetypal character].
gram.function: 通过将杰克比作一个广为人知的文化原型（'one of those little-rascal kids in old black-and-white movies'），作者用一个简洁的文化符号，迅速地为读者构建了杰克的形象和性格——有点淘气、独立、但又很可爱。这种方式比详细描述更高效、更具共鸣。

example.en: With his trench coat and fedora, he looked like a detective from an old noir film.
example.cn: 他穿着风衣、戴着软呢帽，看起来就像一部老黑色电影里的侦探。

gram.constraints: 其效果依赖于读者对所引用原型的熟悉程度。

paras.en: i fish a dollar out of my pocket and watch him cross the street to the grocery store on the corner. he seems too small to be walking around by himself, somehow. then i think how i was that young when i was taking the subway by myself. way too young. i'm going to be an overprotective dad someday, i know it. my kids are going to know i care. i'm waiting there a minute or two when i notice three kids walking up the block from the other direction. they walk right past the grocery store, but one of them looks inside and nudges the other two, and they all back up and look inside. i can tell they're up to no good, all elbowing each other, laughing. one of them is jack's height but the other two look much bigger, more like teens. they hide behind the fruit stand in front of the store, and when jack walks out, they trail behind him, making loud throw-up noises. jack casually turns around at the corner to see who they are and they run away, high-fiving each other and laughing. little jerks.
paras.cn: 我从口袋里掏出一美元，看着他穿过街道去街角的杂货店。不知怎地，他看起来太小了，不该一个人到处走。然后我想起我那么小的时候就自己坐地铁了。太小了。我知道我将来会成为一个过度保护的爸爸。我的孩子们会知道我在乎他们。我在那里等了一两分钟，注意到三个孩子从另一个方向沿街区走上来。他们直接走过了杂货店，但其中一个朝里面看了看，然后用胳膊肘碰了碰另外两个，他们都退了回来朝里面看。我看得出他们不怀好意，都在互相用胳膊肘碰，笑着。其中一个和杰克差不多高，但另外两个看起来大得多，更像是青少年。他们躲在店前的水果摊后面，当杰克走出来时，他们跟在他后面，发出很大的呕吐声。杰克在拐角处随意地转过身看他们是谁，他们就跑开了，互相击掌，大笑着。小混蛋们。

vocab.ex: She fished a pen out of her crowded purse.
He gave her a gentle nudge to get her attention.
The children were too quiet; I knew they were up to no good.
She elbowed me in the ribs to get me to stop talking.
The little ducklings trailed behind their mother.
The bully made throw-up noises to mock the other kid.
Don't be such a jerk to your little sister.

gram.name: 内心独白与自我认知
gram.pattern: An observation leads to a personal memory and a future projection.
gram.function: 通过观察杰克独自行动，叙述者被触发了一段关于自己童年的回忆（'how i was that young...'），并基于这段回忆对自己的未来做出了一个预测（'i'm going to be an overprotective dad'）。这个从外部观察到内部反思，再到未来预测的思维链条，深刻地揭示了角色过去的经历如何塑造他现在的价值观和未来的行为倾向。

example.en: Seeing the lost puppy made her remember her own childhood dog, and she knew she would adopt another one someday.
example.cn: 看到那只走失的小狗让她想起了自己童年的狗，她知道自己总有一天会再领养一只。

gram.constraints: 是一种展示人物心理深度和成长的有效叙事技巧。

paras.en: jack crosses the street like nothing happened and stands next to me at the bus stop, blowing a bubble. friends of yours? i finally say. ha, he says. he's trying to smile but i can see he's upset. just some jerks from my school, he says. a kid named julian and his two gorillas, henry and miles. do they bother you like that a lot? no, they've never done that before. they'd never do that in school or they'd get kicked out. julian lives two blocks from here, so I guess it was just bad luck running into him. oh, okay. i nod.
paras.cn: 杰克像什么都没发生一样穿过街道，站在我旁边的公交车站，吹着一个泡泡。你的朋友？我最后说。哈，他说。他试图微笑，但我能看出他很难过。只是我学校的一些混蛋，他说。一个叫朱利安的孩子和他的两个大猩猩，亨利和迈尔斯。他们经常那样烦你吗？不，他们以前从没那样做过。他们在学校绝不会那么做，否则他们会被开除。朱利安住在这儿两个街区外，所以我猜只是运气不好碰到了他。哦，好的。我点头。

vocab.ex: He dropped the expensive vase, but then just picked up the pieces and acted like nothing happened.
She was chewing gum and trying to blow a bubble.

vocab.mean: 大猩猩（此处比喻高大强壮的跟班）
vocab.ex: The gang leader was always surrounded by his two gorillas.
Please don't bother me while I'm working.
He got kicked out of the club for breaking the rules.
I was surprised to run into my old teacher at the grocery store.

gram.name: 非人化隐喻
gram.pattern: Referring to people as animals to express contempt.
gram.function: 通过将亨利和迈尔斯比作朱利安的“大猩猩”（'gorillas'），杰克使用了一种非人化的隐喻。这个词不仅描绘了他们可能高大强壮的外形，更重要的是，它将他们贬低为没有思想、只会盲从的跟班，以此来表达他对这群人的极度鄙视。

example.en: He treated his employees like sheep, expecting them to follow his orders without question.
example.cn: 他对待员工就像对待绵羊一样，期望他们毫无疑问地服从他的命令。

gram.constraints: 是一种带有强烈负面情感的修辞手法。

paras.en: it's not a big deal, he assures me. we both automatically look down amesfort avenue to see if the bus is coming. we're sort of in a war, he says after a minute, as if that explains everything. then he pulls out this crumpled piece of loose-leaf paper from his jean pocket and gives it to me. i unfold it, and it's a list of names in three columns. he's turned the whole grade against me, says jack. not the whole grade, i point out, looking down at the list. he leaves me notes in my locker that say stuff like everybody hates you.
paras.cn: 没什么大不了的，他向我保证。我们俩都自动地朝艾姆斯福特大道看去，看公交车是否来了。我们算是处于一场战争中，他过了一会儿说，好像那解释了一切。然后他从牛仔裤口袋里掏出一张皱巴巴的活页纸递给我。我展开它，那是一张分三栏的名字列表。他让整个年级都来反对我，杰克说。不是整个年级，我指着名单说。他会留纸条在我储物柜里，上面写着“所有人都讨厌你”之类的。

vocab.ex: Don't worry about breaking the glass; it's not a big deal.
I can assure you that everything will be fine.
When the bell rang, the students automatically stood up.
He found a crumpled up piece of paper in his pocket.
The politician's lies made the public turn against him.

gram.name: 轻描淡写式解释
gram.pattern: Using a simple, understated phrase to explain a complex situation.
gram.function: 杰克没有详细解释复杂的社交动态，而是用了一个非常简洁、但极具概括性的比喻 'we're sort of in a war'。这种轻描淡写的方式，反而比详细的解释更能传达出情况的严重性、对立性和长期性。它是一个“以小见大”的叙事技巧。

example.en: Asked about his difficult childhood, he simply said, 'It was complicated.'
example.cn: 被问及他艰难的童年时，他只简单地说：‘很复杂。’

gram.constraints: 是一种通过简约来传达深层含义的高级技巧。

paras.en: you should tell your teacher about that. jack looks at me like i'm an idiot and shakes his head. anyway, you have all these neutrals, i say, pointing to the list. if you get them on your side, things will even up a bit. yeah, well, that's really going to happen, he says sarcastically. why not? he shoots me another look like i am absolutely the stupidest guy he's ever talked to in the world. what? i say. he shakes his head like i'm hopeless. let's just say, he says, i'm friends with someone who isn't exactly the most popular kid in the school.
paras.cn: 你应该告诉你的老师那件事。杰克看着我，像看一个白痴一样，摇了摇头。不管怎样，你还有所有这些中立派，我指着名单说。如果你能把他们争取到你这边，情况会平衡一点。是啊，嗯，那可真会发生，他讽刺地说。为什么不呢？他又投给我一个眼神，好像我绝对是他在世界上说过话的最蠢的家伙。怎么了？我说。他摇着头，好像我无可救药了。这么说吧，他说，我和一个不完全是学校里最受欢迎的孩子是朋友。

vocab.ex: I felt like an idiot after making such a simple mistake.
In their argument, I tried to remain a neutral.
He scored a goal to even up the game at 2-2.
When I arrived late, he sarcastically said, 'Nice of you to join us.'
She shot him a warning look when he started to tell the secret.
He's hopeless at cooking; he burns everything.

vocab.mean: 这么说吧（用于委婉地引出解释）
vocab.ex: Was the movie good? Let's just say I've seen better.

gram.name: 轻描淡写式解释
gram.pattern: Using an understated phrase to hint at a larger, more complex reason.
gram.function: 杰克没有直接解释为什么争取中立派是不可能的，而是用了一个非常含蓄、轻描淡写的陈述 'let's just say, i'm friends with someone who isn't exactly the most popular kid'。这种方式比直接点明奥古斯特是“问题”所在，更深刻地揭示了问题的根源——即社交隔离的根本原因，同时也展现了他对朋友的忠诚和保护。

example.en: Why was he so angry? Let's just say he had a very bad day.
example.cn: 他为什么那么生气？这么说吧，他度过了非常糟糕的一天。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过暗示来传达复杂信息的有效技巧。

paras.en: then it hits me, what's he's not coming out and saying: august. this is all about his being friends with august. and he doesn't want to tell me because i'm the sister's boyfriend. yeah, of course, makes sense. we see the bus coming down amesfort avenue. well, just hang in there, i tell him, handing back the paper. middle school is about as bad as it gets, and then it gets better. everything'll work out. he shrugs and shoves the list back into his pocket.
paras.cn: 然后我突然明白了，他没有直接说出来的是：奥古斯特。这一切都是因为他和奥古斯特是朋友。他不想告诉我，因为我是他姐姐的男朋友。是啊，当然，说得通。我们看到公交车沿着艾姆斯福特大道驶来。嗯，坚持住吧，我告诉他，把纸还给他。中学差不多就是最糟的时候了，然后情况会好转的。一切都会解决的。他耸耸肩，把名单塞回口袋里。

vocab.ex: I was staring at the puzzle, and then it hit me: the missing piece was under the table.
Why don't you just come out and say what you really think?
His explanation didn't make sense to me.
I know things are tough right now, but just hang in there.
Losing my job and my house in the same week? This is as bad as it gets.
Don't worry; I'm sure everything will work out in the end.
He shoved the book into his backpack and ran out the door.

gram.name: 用普遍化规律进行安慰
gram.pattern: A statement that frames a specific, personal struggle as a universal phase.
gram.function: 通过将杰克当前具体的、痛苦的经历（被孤立）归入一个普遍的人生阶段（'middle school is about as bad as it gets, and then it gets better'），贾斯汀提供了一种超越个人层面的安慰。这种“普遍化”的视角，暗示了当前的痛苦是暂时的、是成长的一部分，从而给予对方希望。

example.en: Everyone feels lost after graduation. It's a normal part of the process, and you'll figure it out.
example.cn: 每个人毕业后都会感到迷茫。那是这个过程的正常部分，你会想明白的。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过提供更宏大视角来给予安慰的有效沟通技巧。

paras.en: we wave bye when he gets on the bus, and i watch it pull away. when i get to the subway station two blocks away, i see the same three kids hanging out in front of the bagel place next door. they're still laughing and yuck-yucking each other like they're some kind of gangbangers, little rich boys in expensive skinny jeans acting tough. don't know what possesses me, but i take my glasses off, put them in my pocket, and tuck my fiddle case under my arm so the pointy side is facing up. i walk over to them, my face scrunched up, mean-looking. they look at me, laughs dying on their lips when they see me, ice cream cones at odd angles. yo, listen up. don't mess with jack, i say really slowly, gritting my teeth, my voice all clint eastwood tough-guy. mess with him again and you will be very, very sorry. and then i tap my fiddle case for effect. got it?
paras.cn: 他上公交车时我们挥手告别，我看着车开走。当我走到两个街区外的地铁站时，我看到同样那三个孩子在隔壁的百吉饼店前闲逛。他们还在笑着，互相嬉闹，就像他们是什么帮派分子一样，穿着昂贵的紧身牛仔裤装硬汉的小富家子弟。不知道是什么附了我的身，但我摘下眼镜，放进口袋，然后把我的小提琴盒夹在胳膊下，让尖的一头朝上。我朝他们走去，脸皱成一团，看起来很凶。他们看着我，看到我时笑声僵在了嘴边，冰淇淋蛋筒也歪向了奇怪的角度。哟，听好了。别惹杰克，我非常缓慢地说，咬着牙，声音全是克林特·伊斯特伍德式的硬汉腔。再惹他一次，你们会非常、非常后悔的。然后我为了效果敲了敲我的小提琴盒。明白了吗？

vocab.ex: We waved goodbye as the train started to pull away from the station.
The group of friends were yuck-yucking at a silly joke.
The movie was about the rivalry between two groups of gangbangers.
Skinny jeans were a very popular fashion trend.
He tries to act tough, but he's actually very sensitive.
I don't know what possessed me to say such a thing.
He scrunched up his face in concentration.

vocab.mean: 咬紧牙关（表示决心或愤怒）
vocab.ex: She had to grit her teeth and endure the painful procedure.
He paused for effect before announcing the winner.

gram.name: 为恐吓而进行的身体转变
gram.pattern: A series of deliberate physical actions to change one's appearance and posture.
gram.function: 叙述者通过一连串有意识的、仪式性的动作（摘眼镜、放口袋、调整琴盒、皱起脸），将自己从一个普通的、戴眼镜的音乐人，转变成一个具有威胁性的“硬汉”形象。这个转变过程本身充满了戏剧性，为接下来的对抗行为做了有力的铺垫，展现了他保护朋友的决心。

example.en: Before the fight, he slowly took off his jacket, rolled up his sleeves, and cracked his knuckles.
example.cn: 打架前，他慢慢脱下夹克，卷起袖子，把指关节捏得咔咔响。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过身体语言来展示人物内心转变和意图的强大叙事技巧。

paras.en: got it? they nod in unison, ice cream dripping onto their hands. good. i nod mysteriously, then sprint down the subway two steps at a time.
paras.cn: 明白了吗？他们齐刷刷地点头，冰淇淋滴到了手上。很好。我神秘地点了点头，然后一次两级台阶地冲下地铁。

vocab.ex: The deadline is Friday. Got it?
The students answered the teacher's question in unison.
Water was dripping from the leaky faucet.
She smiled mysteriously but wouldn't tell me her secret.
He sprinted down the stairs to catch the bus.

gram.name: 高潮式退场
gram.pattern: A final, decisive action that concludes a confrontation.
gram.function: 在成功恐吓了几个男孩之后，叙述者没有继续停留，而是用一个神秘的点头和一个快速、充满活力的动作（'sprint down the subway'）来结束这场对峙。这种“打完就跑”式的戏剧性退场，既保持了他刚刚建立的“硬汉”形象的神秘感，也为整个章节画上了一个干净利落、充满动感的句号，留给读者（和那几个男孩）一个强有力的背影。

example.en: After delivering his final, devastating line, he turned and walked out of the room, leaving everyone speechless.
example.cn: 在说出他最后那句毁灭性的话后，他转身走出了房间，让所有人都哑口无言。

gram.constraints: 是一种在电影和文学中常见的、用于创造令人难忘结尾的技巧。

paras.en: the play is taking up most of my time as we get closer to opening night. lots of lines to remember. long monologues where it's just me talking. olivia had this great idea, though, and it's helping. i have my fiddle with me onstage and play it a bit while i'm talking. It's not written that way, but mr. davenport thinks it adds an extra-folksy element to have the stage manager plucking on a fiddle. and for me it's so great because whenever i need a second to remember my next line, i just start playing a little "soldier's joy" on my fiddle and it buys me some time.
paras.cn: 随着首演之夜的临近，戏剧排练占据了我大部分时间。有很多台词要记。还有很长的独白，就只有我一个人在说。不过，奥利维亚有个很棒的主意，而且很有用。我上台时会带着我的小提琴，一边说话一边拉一点。剧本不是这么写的，但达文波特先生认为让舞台监督拨弄小提琴会增添一种额外的民谣元素。这对我来说太棒了，因为每当 我需要一秒钟来记起下一句台词时，我只要开始在小提琴上拉一点《士兵的喜悦》，就能为我争取一些时间。

vocab.ex: This new project is going to take up a lot of my time.
The actor delivered a powerful and emotional monologue.

vocab.mean: 小提琴（尤指用于民间音乐）
vocab.ex: He played a lively tune on his fiddle at the country fair.
The band has a charming, folksy style of music.
She sat by the fire, gently plucking the strings of her guitar.
He asked a long question to buy his friend some time to think of an answer.

gram.name: it 作形式宾语
gram.pattern: Verb + it + [adj/noun] + to + infinitive
gram.function: 当不定式短语作宾语且后面有宾补时，常用 'it' 作形式宾语，而将不定式短语后置。'...it adds an extra-folksy element to have the stage manager plucking...' 中的 'it' 指代的是后面的不定式短语 'to have the stage manager plucking...'。

example.en: I find it difficult to wake up early in the morning.
example.cn: 我发现早上早起很困难。

gram.constraints: 常与 find, think, believe, consider, make 等动词连用。

paras.en: i've gotten to know the kids in the show a lot better, especially the pink-haired girl who plays emily. turns out she's not nearly as stuck-up as i thought she was, given the crowd she hangs out with. her boyfriend's this built jock who's a big deal on the varsity sports circuit at school. it's a whole world that i have nothing to do with, so i'm kind of surprised that this miranda girl turns out to be kind of nice.
paras.cn: 我跟剧组里的孩子们熟悉多了，尤其是那个扮演艾米丽的粉色头发的女孩。结果发现她远没有我想象的那么自命不凡，考虑到她交往的那群人。她男朋友是那种肌肉发达的运动员，在学校的校队体育圈里是个大人物。那是一个与我毫无关系的全新世界，所以我有点惊讶这个叫米兰达的女孩结果人还挺好的。

vocab.ex: It takes time to really get to know someone.
The movie turned out to be much better than I expected.

vocab.mean: （非正式）自命不凡的；摆架子的
vocab.ex: He's so stuck-up he won't even talk to his old friends anymore.
Given his age, he's a remarkably fast runner.

vocab.mean: （俚语）运动员（尤指在学校里受欢迎的）
vocab.ex: In many high school movies, the jock is the main character's rival.
Don't worry about the small mistake, it's not a big deal.
He was the captain of the varsity basketball team.
His personal life has nothing to do with his ability to do the job.

gram.name: Given 作为介词
gram.pattern: given + noun/noun phrase
gram.function: 用于引出一个已知的事实或情况，作为后面陈述的背景或原因，意为“考虑到”。'...given the crowd she hangs out with' 意思是“考虑到她交往的那群人（的通常表现）”。

example.en: She did a great job, given the short amount of time she had.
example.cn: 考虑到她时间很短，她做得非常出色了。

gram.constraints: 是一种较为正式和书面的用法，用于提供上下文。

paras.en: one day we're sitting on the floor backstage waiting for the tech guys to fix the main spotlight. so how long have you and olivia been dating? she asks out of the blue. about four months now, i say. have you met her brother? she says casually. it's so unexpected that i can't hide my surprise.
paras.cn: 一天，我们正坐在后台的地板上，等着技术人员修理主聚光灯。 “你和奥利维亚交往多久了？” 她出乎意料地问道。“大概四个月了，” 我说。“你见过她弟弟吗？” 她随口说道。这太出乎意料了，我无法掩饰我的惊讶。

vocab.ex: The actors were getting ready backstage before the show.
We had to call the tech guys to fix the broken computer.
The singer stood alone in the spotlight on the stage.
I hadn't heard from him in years, then he called me out of the blue.
He casually mentioned that he was moving to another country.

gram.name: 叙事现在时
gram.pattern: Using present tense to narrate past events.
gram.function: 作者使用现在时（'we're sitting', 'she asks', 'i say'）来讲述一个过去的故事，使事件感觉更加生动、直接和身临其境，仿佛正在读者眼前发生。

example.en: So I walk into the room, and what do I see? A huge mess!
example.cn: 于是我走进房间，你猜我看到了什么？一团糟！

gram.constraints: 是一种文学和口语叙事技巧，用于增加故事的吸引力。

paras.en: you know olivia's brother? i ask. via didn't tell you? we used to be good friends. i've known auggie since he was a baby. oh, yeah, i think i knew that, i answer. i don't want to let on that olivia had not told me any of this. i don't want to let on how surprised i am that she called her via. nobody but olivia's family calls her via, and here this pink-haired girl, who i thought was a stranger, is calling her via.
paras.cn: “你认识奥利维亚的弟弟？” 我问。“维娅没告诉你吗？我们以前是好朋友。我从奥吉还是个婴儿的时候就认识他了。” “哦，是的，我想我知道那个，” 我回答。我不想透露奥利维亚没有告诉我任何这些事。我不想透露我对她叫她“维娅”有多惊讶。除了奥利维亚的家人，没人叫她维娅，而现在这个我以为是陌生人的粉色头发女孩，却在叫她维娅。

vocab.ex: Don't let on that you know about the surprise party.
Nobody but his closest friends knew his secret.
My mother always told me not to talk to strangers.

gram.name: 用于内心思考的平行结构
gram.pattern: Repetition of a key phrase

components.slot: i don't want to let on

gram.function: 通过重复 'i don't want to let on...' 这一短语，作者强调了叙述者内心的双重惊讶以及他努力掩饰这种惊讶的强烈意图。这种重复揭示了他的内心活动和社交策略。

example.en: He didn't want to show he was scared. He didn't want to show any weakness at all.
example.cn: 他不想表现出他很害怕。他一点也不想表现出任何软弱。

gram.constraints: 是一种有效的揭示角色内心状态的文学技巧。

paras.en: miranda laughs and shakes her head but she doesn't say anything. there's an awkward silence and then she starts fishing through her bag and pulls out her wallet. she rifles through a couple of pictures and then hands one to me. it's of a little boy in a park on a sunny day. he's wearing shorts and a t-shirt—and an astronaut helmet that covers his entire head. it was like a hundred degrees that day, she says, smiling at the picture. but he wouldn't take that helmet off for anything. he wore it for like two years straight, in the winter, in the summer, at the beach. it was crazy.
paras.cn: 米兰达笑着摇了摇头，但什么也没说。一阵尴尬的沉默，然后她开始在她的包里翻找，并拿出了她的钱包。她迅速翻过几张照片，然后递给我一张。照片上是一个小男孩，在一个晴天里站在公园里。他穿着短裤和T恤——还有一个盖住他整个脑袋的宇航员头盔。“那天大概有一百度，” 她看着照片微笑着说。“但他就是死活不肯摘下那个头盔。他大概连续戴了两年，冬天、夏天、在海滩上都戴着。简直太疯狂了。”

vocab.ex: After his strange comment, there was an awkward silence in the room.
She was fishing through her purse looking for her keys.
He rifled through the drawers, searching for the missing document.
The little boy wore his favorite toy astronaut helmet everywhere.
I wouldn't sell this old watch for anything; it was my grandfather's.

gram.name: 一般过去时的连续动作
gram.pattern: Subject + Verb1, Verb2, and Verb3...
gram.function: 使用一连串的简单过去时动词（'laughs', 'shakes', 'starts', 'pulls out', 'rifles through', 'hands'）来描述一连串快速发生的、连续的动作，创造出一种清晰的、电影般的画面感。

example.en: He walked into the kitchen, opened the fridge, took out the milk, and poured a glass.
example.cn: 他走进厨房，打开冰箱，拿出牛奶，倒了一杯。

gram.constraints: 是叙事中创建清晰时间线的基本技巧。

paras.en: yeah, i've seen pictures in olivia's house. i'm the one who gave him that helmet, she says. she sounds a little proud of that. she takes the picture and carefully inserts it back into her wallet. cool, i answer. so you're okay with it? she says, looking at me. i look at her blankly. okay with what? she raises her eyebrows like she doesn't believe me. you know what i'm talking about, she says, and takes a long drink from her water bottle. let's face it, she continues, the universe was not kind to auggie pullman.
paras.cn: “是啊，我在奥利维亚家见过照片。” “那个头盔是我给他的，” 她说。她听起来对此有点自豪。她拿起照片，小心地把它插回钱包里。“酷，” 我回答。“所以你对此没意见？” 她看着我说。我茫然地看着她。“对什么没意见？” 她扬起眉毛，好像不相信我。“你知道我在说什么，” 她说，然后从她的水瓶里喝了一大口水。“面对现实吧，” 她继续说，“宇宙对奥吉·普尔曼并不友善。”

vocab.ex: She was very proud of her daughter for winning the award.
Please insert your card into the machine.
He just stared blankly at the wall, lost in thought.

vocab.mean: 扬起眉毛（表示惊讶或怀疑）
vocab.ex: She raised her eyebrows when she heard the surprising news.
Let's face it, we are not going to win this game.

gram.name: 拟人化与轻描淡写
gram.pattern: Giving human qualities to abstract concepts in a matter-of-fact way.
gram.function: 将人类的品质（'kind'）赋予抽象的“宇宙”，这是一种拟人化。同时，用“不友善”（not kind）这样一个轻描淡写的词来描述一个深刻而残酷的事实，这种反差使得这句话更加有力、更令人心酸。

example.en: Fate wasn't exactly on his side that day.
example.cn: 那天，命运并不怎么站在他那边。

gram.constraints: 是一种高级的修辞手法，用于表达复杂的情感和观点。

paras.en: why didn't you tell me that you and miranda navas used to be friends? i say to olivia the next day. i'm really annoyed at her for not telling me this. it's not a big deal, she answers defensively, looking at me like i'm weird. it is a big deal, i say. i looked like an idiot. how could you not tell me? you've always acted like you don't even know her.
paras.cn: “你为什么没告诉我你和米兰达·纳瓦斯以前是朋友？” 第二天我问奥利维亚。我真的很生她没告诉我这件事的气。“没什么大不了的，” 她辩解地回答，看我的眼神像是我很奇怪似的。“这很要紧，” 我说。“我看起来像个傻瓜。你怎么能不告诉我？你一直表现得好像你根本不认识她。”

vocab.ex: He was annoyed at his friend for being late.
Don't worry about breaking the glass; it's not a big deal.
When she criticized his work, he responded defensively.
I felt like a complete idiot when I realized I had left my keys in the car.

gram.name: 叙事现在时
gram.pattern: Using present tense to narrate past events.
gram.function: 作者使用现在时（'i say', 'she answers'）来讲述一个过去的故事，使事件感觉更加生动、直接和身临其境，仿佛正在读者眼前发生。

example.en: So I walk into the room, and what do I see? A huge mess!
example.cn: 于是我走进房间，你猜我看到了什么？一团糟！

gram.constraints: 是一种文学和口语叙事技巧，用于增加故事的吸引力。

paras.en: i don't know her, she answers quickly. i don't know who that pink-haired cheerleader is. the girl i knew was a total dork who collected american girl dolls. oh come on, olivia. you come on! you could have mentioned it to me at some point, i say quietly, pretending not to notice the big fat tear that's suddenly rolling down her cheek. she shrugs, fighting back bigger tears.
paras.cn: “我不认识她，” 她迅速回答。“我不知道那个粉色头发的啦啦队长是谁。我认识的那个女孩是个十足的呆子，收集美国女孩娃娃。” “哦，得了吧，奥利维亚。” “你才得了吧！” “你总可以在某个时候跟我提一下的，” 我轻声说，假装没注意到一颗大大的泪珠突然从她脸颊上滚落。她耸了耸肩，忍着更多快要夺眶而出的泪水。

vocab.ex: She was a popular cheerleader in high school.
He called me a dork just because I like reading comic books.

vocab.mean: 得了吧；拜托（表示不相信或不耐烦）
vocab.ex: Oh come on, you can't be serious!
We need to discuss this at some point, but not right now.
She tried to fight back tears as she said goodbye.

gram.name: could have + 过去分词
gram.pattern: could have + past participle
gram.function: 用于表示过去有能力或有机会做某事但实际上没有做，常带有责备或遗憾的意味。'you could have mentioned it...' 意思是“你本可以提一下的（但你没提）”，表达了叙述者的不满。

example.en: You could have called me to say you would be late.
example.cn: 你本可以打电话告诉我你会迟到的。

gram.constraints: 用于虚拟语气，谈论与过去事实相反的情况。

paras.en: it's okay, i'm not mad, i say, thinking the tears are about me. i honestly don't care if you're mad, she says spitefully. oh, that's real nice, i fire back. she doesn't say anything. the tears are about to come. olivia, what's the matter? i say. she shakes her head like she doesn't want to talk about it, but all of a sudden the tears start rolling a mile a minute.
paras.cn: “没关系，我没生气，” 我说，以为眼泪是因我而流。“我才不在乎你生不生气，” 她恶狠狠地说。“哦，那可真好，” 我回击道。她什么也没说。眼泪快要流出来了。“奥利维亚，怎么了？” 我说。她摇摇头，像是不想谈论这个，但突然之间眼泪开始飞快地滚落下来。

vocab.ex: Please don't be mad at me for being late.
She spoke spitefully about her former friend.
When he criticized her, she immediately fired back with a witty comment.
You look sad. What's the matter?
He talks a mile a minute; it's hard to keep up.

gram.name: 反讽
gram.pattern: Saying the opposite of what you mean.
gram.function: 通过说出与真实意图相反的话来表达嘲讽或不满。'oh, that's real nice' 表面上是夸奖，但在上下文中，叙述者实际的意思是“你这样说真刻薄”，是一种典型的反讽。

example.en: You forgot my birthday again? Oh, that's just wonderful.
example.cn: 你又忘了我的生日？哦，那真是太棒了。

gram.constraints: 理解反讽需要依赖上下文和语气。

paras.en: i'm sorry, it's not you, justin. i'm not crying because of you, she finally says through her tears. then why are you crying? because i'm an awful person. what are you talking about? she's not looking at me, wiping her tears with the palm of her hand. i haven't told my parents about the show, she says quickly.
paras.cn: “对不起，不是因为你，贾斯汀。我不是因为你才哭的，” 她终于透过泪水说道。“那你为什么哭？” “因为我是个糟糕的人。” “你在说什么？” 她没有看我，用手掌擦着眼泪。“我还没告诉我父母关于演出的事，” 她迅速地说。

vocab.ex: She managed to whisper a thank you through her tears.
I feel awful about what happened.
Please wipe your feet before you come inside.
He held the small bird gently in the palm of his hand.

gram.name: not because of...
gram.pattern: not because of + noun/pronoun
gram.function: 用于明确否定某个事物是原因。'i'm not crying because of you' 是奥利维亚用来澄清她哭泣的原因，以消除贾斯汀的误会。

example.en: The game was cancelled not because of the rain, but due to a scheduling conflict.
example.cn: 比赛被取消不是因为下雨，而是由于日程冲突。

gram.constraints: 'because of' 后面跟名词或代词，而 'because' 后面跟从句。

paras.en: i shake my head because i don't quite get what she's telling me. that's okay, i say. it's not too late, there are still tickets available— i don't want them to come to the show, justin, she interrupts impatiently. don't you see what i'm saying? i don't want them to come! if they come, they'll bring auggie with them, and i just don't feel like . . . here she's hit by another round of crying that doesn't let her finish talking. i put my arm around her.
paras.cn: 我摇了摇头，因为我不太明白她在说什么。“没关系，” 我说。“还不算晚，还有票——” “我不想让他们来看演出，贾斯汀，” 她不耐烦地打断道。“你难道不明白我在说什么吗？我不想让他们来！如果他们来，他们会带着奥吉一起来，而我只是不想......” 这时，她又被一阵哭泣击中，让她无法说完话。我用胳膊搂住了她。

vocab.ex: I'm sorry, I don't quite get what you're trying to explain.
She tapped her foot impatiently while waiting in line.
He was suddenly hit by a round of coughing.
He put his arm around his friend to comfort her.

gram.name: 破折号（表示打断）
gram.pattern: Sentence —
gram.function: 用于表示说话被打断。'...tickets available—' 表明贾斯汀的话还没说完就被奥利维亚打断了。

example.en: "I was just about to tell you—" she began, but the phone rang.
example.cn: “我正要告诉你——” 她开口说，但电话响了。

gram.constraints: 是表现对话动态的有效标点。

paras.en: i'm an awful person! she says through her tears. you're not an awful person, i say softly. yes i am! she sobs. it's just been so nice being in a new school where nobody knows about him, you know? nobody's whispering about it behind my back. it's just been so nice, justin. but if he comes to the play, then everyone will talk about it, everyone will know. . . . i don't know why i'm feeling like this. . . . i swear i've never been embarrassed by him before.
paras.cn: “我是个糟糕的人！” 她含着泪说。“你不是个糟糕的人，” 我轻声说。“我就是！” 她抽泣着。“在一个没人知道他的新学校里感觉太好了，你知道吗？没人背后议论这件事。感觉太好了，贾斯汀。但如果他来看戏，那所有人都会谈论这件事，所有人都会知道……我不知道我为什么会有这种感觉……我发誓我以前从来没有因为他而感到尴尬过。”

vocab.ex: I feel awful about what happened.
The child started to sob when he couldn't find his mother.
It's not nice to talk about people behind their backs.
She was embarrassed by her father's loud singing.

gram.name: 第一条件句
gram.pattern: If + present simple, ... will + infinitive
gram.function: 用于描述一个将来可能发生的真实情况及其可能的结果。'if he comes to the play, then everyone will talk about it' 表明了奥利维亚对未来事件的担忧和预测。

example.en: If it rains tomorrow, the picnic will be cancelled.
example.cn: 如果明天下雨，野餐就会被取消。

gram.constraints: 条件从句使用一般现在时，主句使用一般将来时。

paras.en: i know, i know, i say, soothing her. you're entitled, olivia. you've dealt with a lot your whole life. olivia reminds me of a bird sometimes, how her feathers get all ruffled when she's mad. and when she's fragile like this, she's a little lost bird looking for its nest. so i give her my wing to hide under.
paras.cn: “我知道，我知道，” 我说，安慰着她。“你有权利这样想，奥利维亚。你一生中已经处理了很多事了。” 奥利维亚有时让我想起一只鸟，当她生气时，她的羽毛如何全部竖起。而当她像这样脆弱时，她就像一只寻找巢穴的迷路小鸟。所以我给了她我的翅膀让她躲在下面。

vocab.ex: He tried to soothe the crying baby with a lullaby.

vocab.mean: 有权利（做某事或有某种感受）
vocab.ex: After a long week of work, you're entitled to a rest.
She has had to deal with many challenges in her life.
The angry bird had ruffled feathers.
Be careful with that vase; it's very fragile.

gram.name: 扩展隐喻
gram.pattern: Developing a single metaphor or analogy at length.
gram.function: 作者不仅仅是说“奥利维亚像一只鸟”，而是将这个比喻扩展开来：生气时像“羽毛竖起”，脆弱时像“迷路的小鸟”。最后，叙述者自己也融入这个比喻，提供“翅膀”让她躲藏。这种扩展使得比喻更加丰富、深刻和富有情感。

example.en: He was a lion in the courtroom, roaring his objections and fiercely protecting his client.
example.cn: 他在法庭上是一头雄狮，咆哮着提出反对意见，并勇猛地保护他的客户。

gram.constraints: 是一种高级的文学技巧，用于构建生动的意象和主题。

paras.en: i can't sleep tonight. my head is full of thoughts that won't turn off. lines from my monologues. elements of the periodic table that i'm supposed to be memorizing. theorems i'm supposed to be understanding. olivia. auggie.
paras.cn: 我今晚睡不着。我的脑子里充满了关不掉的思绪。我独白的台词。我本该背诵的元素周期表。我本该理解的定理。奥利维亚。奥吉。

vocab.ex: My brain won't turn off at night when I'm stressed.
The actor delivered a powerful and emotional monologue.
Chemistry students have to memorize the elements of the periodic table.
He had to memorize a long poem for his English class.
Pythagoras's theorem is fundamental in geometry.

gram.name: 连接词省略/碎片化列表
gram.pattern: A list of nouns or phrases without conjunctions.
gram.function: 通过省略并列连词（如 'and'），作者创造了一个快速、断续的列表（'lines... elements... theorems... olivia. auggie.'）。这种手法（称为连接词省略）模仿了思绪不受控制地快速闪现的感觉，生动地传达了叙述者焦虑和失眠的状态。

example.en: He came, he saw, he conquered.
example.cn: 他来了，他看见了，他征服了。

gram.constraints: 是一种用于创造特定节奏和情绪的修辞技巧。

paras.en: miranda's words keep coming back: the universe was not kind to auggie pullman. i'm thinking about that a lot and everything it means. she's right about that. the universe was not kind to auggie pullman. what did that little kid ever do to deserve his sentence? what did the parents do? or olivia? she once mentioned that some doctor told her parents that the odds of someone getting the same combination of syndromes that came together to make auggie's face were like one in four million. so doesn't that make the universe a giant lottery, then? you purchase a ticket when you're born. and it's all just random whether you get a good ticket or a bad ticket. it's all just luck.
paras.cn: 米兰达的话不断浮现：宇宙对奥吉·普尔曼并不友善。我一直在想这句话以及它所包含的一切意义。她是对的。宇宙对奥吉·普尔曼并不友善。那个小孩子到底做了什么要承受这样的命运？他的父母做了什么？或者奥利维亚呢？她曾有一次提到，某个医生告诉她父母，有人得到同样综合征组合，最终形成奥吉那样面容的几率，大约是四百万分之一。那么，这不就让宇宙成了一个巨大的彩票吗？你出生时就购买了一张票。而你得到的是一张好票还是一张坏票，完全是随机的。一切都只是运气。

vocab.ex: That sad memory keeps coming back to me, even after all these years.
After all his hard work, he deserves a vacation.
He felt his illness was a life sentence of pain.
The odds of winning the lottery are incredibly low.
The doctor diagnosed him with a rare genetic syndrome.
Finding a perfect job can feel like winning the lottery.
The winner was chosen by a random number generator.

gram.name: 反问句（用于探究）
gram.pattern: A question asked for effect, not for an answer.
gram.function: 叙述者提出一系列问题（'what did that little kid ever do...? ...doesn't that make the universe a giant lottery...?'），但并非为了寻求答案，而是为了表达他对命运不公的痛苦思考和哲学探究。这些问题推动了他的内心独白，引出了“宇宙是随机的”这一初步结论。

example.en: After all this suffering, what is the meaning of it all?
example.cn: 经历了这一切苦难之后，这一切的意义到底是什么？

gram.constraints: 其功能是表达观点或引发思考，而非获取信息。

paras.en: my head swirls on this, but then softer thoughts soothe, like a flatted third on a major chord. no, no, it's not all random, if it really was all random, the universe would abandon us completely. and the universe doesn't. it takes care of its most fragile creations in ways we can't see. like with parents who adore you blindly. and a big sister who feels guilty for being human over you. and a little gravelly-voiced kid whose friends have left him over you. and even a pink-haired girl who carries your picture in her wallet. maybe it is a lottery, but the universe makes it all even out in the end. the universe takes care of all its birds.
paras.cn: 我的思绪为此纷乱，但接着更柔和的想法抚慰了我，就像大调和弦上的一个降三音。不，不，并非一切都是随机的，如果真的全是随机，宇宙会完全抛弃我们。而宇宙没有。它以我们看不见的方式照顾着它最脆弱的造物。比如有盲目崇拜你的父母。还有一个因为在你面前做了凡人而感到内疚的姐姐。还有一个声音沙哑的小孩，他的朋友因为你而离开了他。甚至还有一个粉色头发的女孩，在钱包里放着你的照片。也许这确实是场彩票，但宇宙最终会让一切都变得平衡。宇宙会照顾好它所有的鸟儿。

vocab.ex: Doubts and fears swirl in my mind before an exam.
The mother's lullaby helped to soothe the crying baby.
In jazz music, a flatted third is a common element that adds a bluesy feel.
The crew had to abandon the sinking ship.
Handle the antique vase with care; it's very fragile.
She absolutely adores her grandchildren and spoils them.
The old sailor had a deep, gravelly-voiced laugh.
The scores in the game started to even out in the second half.

gram.name: 首语重复法 (Anaphora)
gram.pattern: Repetition of a phrase at the beginning of successive clauses.
gram.function: 叙述者通过重复相似的结构（'like with parents...', 'and a big sister...', 'and a little... kid...', 'and even a pink-haired girl...'）来列举一系列积极的例子。这种首语重复法（anaphora）建立了一种强大的、累积的论证，证明宇宙确实提供了关爱和平衡，创造出一种诗意而令人安心的节奏。

example.en: We will fight on the beaches, we will fight on the landing grounds, we will fight in the fields and in the streets.
example.cn: 我们将在沙滩上战斗，我们将在登陆地上战斗，我们将在田野和街道上战斗。

gram.constraints: 是一种强有力的修辞手法，用于强调和增强情感。

gram.name: 扩展隐喻
gram.pattern: Developing a single metaphor or analogy at length.
gram.function: 文本以“宇宙会照顾好它所有的鸟儿”结尾。这与前一章将奥利维亚比作“鸟”相呼应，并将这个比喻扩展到所有脆弱的生命。它将奥吉、奥利维亚等角色统一在一个共同的意象之下，暗示他们都在宇宙的（或人与人之间相互的）关爱之中，为篇章提供了一个充满希望和诗意的结尾。

example.en: Life is a journey. There are smooth roads and bumpy paths, but the destination is what matters.
example.cn: 人生是一场旅途。有平坦的大道，也有崎岖的小路，但目的地才是最重要的。

gram.constraints: 是一种高级的文学技巧，用于构建生动的意象和主题。
